intro: Saurauia tayabensis, commonly known as the Tayabensis Saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Luzon. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
